title: Release v0.7
body:
It's ready.

The major focus of this release is "view widgets": the ability to construct a
synchronised view over shared data.

The new view widgets allow completion of the "CRUD" (Create, Read, Update,
Delete) [7GUIs challenge app](https://github.com/kas-gui/7guis/). The use of
view widgets allows data-UI separation and scaling to larger data sets (mainly
limited by the `O(n)` filter in this example). Work also started on the Cells
challenge (mini-spreadsheet), though many details of the app and of the
`MatrixView` widget still need addressing, especially drawing, multi-cell
selection and keyboard handling.

Additionally, this version saw development of a new mini-library, `kas::conv`,
which spun off into its own lib [easy-cast](https://crates.io/crates/easy-cast).

[Read the full CHANGELOG here.](https://github.com/kas-gui/kas/blob/441d1e061a4031314e5df63887f51038b5544135/CHANGELOG.md#070--2021-04-03)

Note: for now, KAS requires the beta compiler (1.52.0, scheduled for release in early May).

See also the [KAS tutorial series](https://kas-gui.github.io/tutorials/).

title: Fix view selection from child; use window_clipboard; update deps
Update MSRV; CI: re-enable windows tests; add beta toolchain tests
Arrow and tab navigation for views; EditGuard::focus_gained
body:
`EditGuard` now has a `focus_gained` method, allowing custom actions on gaining text-input focus.

Replace `Layout::spatial_range` with `spatial_nav`, fixing iteration order for elements in `ListView` and `MatrixView` (but not changing the odd behaviour that sometimes tab scrolls to new elements and sometimes it doesn't).

Implement arrow-key and page up/down, home and end key navigation for `ListView` and for `MatrixView` where the immediate widget supports key-navigation.

title: Shared data traits revision
body:
Quite a few changes here including many renames/moves. Significant changes:

- `MatrixData` has a new unified `Key` type plus `make_key` method
- `dynamic`/`dynamic-view` examples renamed to `data-list` / `data-list-view`
- `Driver` loses parameterised constructor `new`, has old `default` renamed to `new`, and loses `get`
- `Driver::Msg` added; impls updated to use appropriate message type
- `UpdatableHandler` added, allowing message handlers on shared data
- `set_text_and_prepare`: support usage before UI is initialised
- documentation improvements

title: Matrix view
body:
A matrix view is a form of table view (a little more limited since all cells most have the same type).

Also:

- `kas::widget::view::ListMsg` → `kas::event::ChildMsg`
- Add `FrameRules::surround_inner`
- Minor fixes to `ListView`
- `SizeHandle` gets some new methods: `pixels_from_virtual`, `pixels_from_points`, `pixels_from_em`
- Add `WidgetExt` trait with `reserve` and `map_msg` methods
- New `kas::adapter` module

title: Misc: reorg view-widget traits, add NavFrame and Response::Select, some fixes
Revise StretchPolicy → Stretch; shared data fixes + ListData::contrains_key
body:
The `StretchPolicy` type was revised, mostly to make clear that what was `StretchPolicy::Fixed` does not actually fix the size. Text types no longer use `Filler` policy (except buttons horizontally) since this may have unintended consequences.

`FilteredList` now applies the filter to all methods, not just to iteration. `ListData` has an extra method.

`ListView` will now deselect data which is no longer visible.

title: Recursive data updates; reorganise core widget traits
body:
Shared data traits got significantly revised to better handle updates, especially for derived types (filters). This allows correct updating in the 7-GUIs CRUD example.

Data trait hierarchy is not ideal but I haven't found a better solution:

- `SharedData`
- `SharedDataRec: SharedData` (extension which may only be implementable in some cases, such as on `Rc<T>`)
- `ListData: SharedDataRec` (this could depend on just `SharedData` or be independent, but then we'd need multi-trait objects (https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/issues/2035) for dyn objects)
- `ListDataMut: ListData` (an obvious extension)

We could instead have `ListDataRec: ListData + SharedData`, but then we'd also need `SingleDataRec`.

Reorganised:

- Core widget traits have been moved into `kas::core` (internal)
- `Future` moved into `kas::future` (internal)
- `ThemeAction` and `ThemeApi` are moved into `kas::draw` (affects API)
- Shared data traits moved into `kas::data` (affects API)

title: Event config & ComboBox closure
body:
`ComboBox` now uses a closure to produce a message instead of storing a message for each variant. It also now supports removal of all choices (a corner case which we chose not to support previously, but this made the API ungainly).

Closes #166: implements configuration for the most important parts (other things can be revisited later if needed, but don't need a tracker for now). Specifically, we now have config for:

- shortcuts: now is optional
- menu-open delay
- text selection via touch delay
- distance moved before touch events start panning text
- when mouse click+drag can pan text and other objects

Text panning and selection logic from the mouse and touch events has been extracted from `EditField`.

Update timers now can carry a payload, useful to identify multiple timers on a single widget.

This PR also updates the README and ROADMAP (which was ignored for a while).

title: View widgets: reorg, more widgets, data write, dynamic-view example
body:
This is a big PR:

- view widget modules were reorganised
- new `View` trait replaces `ViewWidget`, allowing custom construction/get/set and data payload
- all applicable standard "data" widgets are usable with the `View` trait
- data traits get new `update` method; `set` takes `&mut self`; internal `RefCell` sometimes required
- new `dynamic-view` example (variant of `dynamic` with `O(1)` performance w.r.t. number of data entries)
- `ScrollWidget` trait renamed to `Scrollable`
- Add `Response::Update` to indicate a data update with no message
- Remove data payload from `Response::Unhandled`

title: Examples: async-event, cursor gallery
body:
This adds two examples (heavily inspired by Druid's examples), plus a few small changes:

- `WidgetChildren::find_child` was renamed to `find_leaf` since it finds the leaf-most descendant; a new `find_child` method was added, returning the index of the child which is an ancestor of the given id
- Setting a hover cursor icon for a widget now applies transitively to descendants, where those descendants' icons are `Default`. This simplifies the new example but it isn't clear if this is the right choice (or if `cursor_icon` should return `Option<CursorIcon>` so that children can force the default icon). It may be necessary to revisit this later.
- `SizeRules` has two new constructors to ease use with virtual pixels ~~(though given that these are purely convenience wrappers, possibly they should assume both margins are the same)~~ done.

title: Misc: programmatic selection, reduced draws, nav changes, ...
body:
Handling for keys changes: `Escape` can now be sent to widgets in more cases, only deselecting if not otherwise used.

Several small changes and fixes; see below.

title: View widgets: trait revision, reliable keys
body:
This replaces the `Accessor` trait with `SingleData`, `SingleDataMut`, `ListData`, `ListDataMut`. In a way these are simpler; they also have a type of iterator (a ridiculous vec generator until GATs allow real iterators).

Keys are now the same for a list and its filtered version, so list selection now works properly on filtered lists.

Also moves `derive(Widget)` before its attributes (avoids a warning with recent Rustc).

---

This code needs significant optimisation (some enabled by GATs, some to do with filtering, probably some other opts too), but appears to work fine other than perf.

One notable possibility: `update_widgets` gets called whenever scrolling occurs, which may be multiple times per frame — especially since rendering appears to only happen after event handling is finished. With fast scrolling this can essentially block drawing until the mouse stops moving. We could try solving this by only calling `update_widgets` after receiving all events (via `ManagerState::update`), but in this case state would be incorrect if other event handlers referring to the list's children somehow get called before `update`.

title: ViewList: multiple selection modes
body:
Allows single/multiple or no selection with `ViewList`, which should be enough for the 7GUIs CRUD example app ...

... except that selection identifiers are dependent on the filter. Solving this requires significant changes to the `Accessor` trait.

Further, the `Accessor` trait needs some tweaks for write support (e.g. for cell editing within a spreadsheet).

title: ViewList selection, set_component, scroll-region margins
body:
ViewList now supports item selection via click (toggle on click). This is a little basic and doesn't support things like range-selection or a "select-all" command and has a simple backing type, thus probably needs extending later.

Scroll-region margins saw some revision: contents are now surrounded by a margin correctly, while keeping the margin within the drawable scroll-region.

`Size`, `Coord` and `Offset` now have a `set_component` method, simplifying several `size_rules` impls.

title: Margins, FrameRules
body:
Adds a `FrameRules` type as a special variant of `SizeRules`.

Some fixes and tweaks around margins, and new `text_margin` (between `inner_margin` and `outer_margin`).

title: Revise handlers for controls
body:
Closes #159

Motivation:

- previously, `TextButton` was not constructible without a (non-void) message, implying that the parent *must* implement a handler immediately; this complicates tutorials and layout design unnecessarily
- unify handlers and make the more powerful

We consider the following widgets:

- `TextButton` (no state)
- `CheckBox` (bool state)
- `RadioBox` (identifier, but this is really only an implementation detail)
- `ComboBox` (selection index)
- `EditField` (significant state, multiple actions to handle)

For `TextButton` and `RadioBox`, a message payload would suffice, but for uniformity and simpler local handling, we may as well use a closure like `CheckBox`.

Local handlers which *must* return a message do not properly satisfy the first point of motivation, hence we make the closure's result `Option<M>`, in line with what `EditField`'s guards already do. We also add a `&mut Manager` parameter here, because it's potentially useful to update "view" widgets and the only real cost is that users must add an extra `_` parameter to handlers. (Note that we already cannot use these handlers when widgets are updated via methods like `HasBool::set_bool` since these methods cannot pass a message to the parent, hence we always have a `mgr` available where these handlers might be called.)

Note that #159 suggests a more complex alternative with "guard" traits for each widget, but this is rejected due to unnecessary complexity (we *might* revisit this decision later, given sufficient evidence for their uses, but external handlers in the parent widget already have all this capability so there's likely no need).

`EditField` remains with the `EditGuard` trait design since this is more complex and this guard useful for things like setting the error state or actions which happen for multiple events, such as `on_afl`.

`ComboBox` remains as-is for now... possibly each entry should instead be something *viewable* as a label and which can generate a message... or possibly it should have an `on_select` handler to replace the current message payloads. It's probably better to wait until after further work on view widgets and image labels has been done, and maybe until more examples are available.

title: EditField, README, tweak alignment
body:
`EditBox` is now a wrapper around `EditField`, which inherited most of the old `EditBox`'s logic. `EditField` can be used directly (without borders or background).

Some changes to alignment and stretch policies (see commits).

Readme update.

title: Config read/write support
body:
Adds working read & write support for shortcut configuration.

JSON and YAML support are included. TOML is not because the `toml` crate does not support enums as map keys and I don't see another TOML+Serde crate.

Adjusts `kas_wgpu::Options`, adding two env vars controlling behaviour.

Some cleanup is needed before merge, but otherwise I think this is good for now. The file format is unstable and until that changes, there won't be a default config path, though later there should be (using the `directories` crate or similar).

~~TODO: cleanup commits, better documentation?~~

Edit: done cleanup; serde is now optional.

title: Shortcuts: extend, add specific MacOS shortcuts; rename ControlKey → Command
body:
MacOS and Windows should now have most of the right shortcuts for text-editing, plus a bunch more (currently unused). There's currently no differentiation between Linux (KDE, Gnome, ...) and Windows and no direct consideration for anything else — probably testing and feedback is needed.

Run-time and application-specific configuration is obviously needed and being planned.

Some system for handling global shortcuts is also required — e.g. whether `Exit` (Ctrl+Q on most platforms) closes the app immediately or prompts or does nothing (current behaviour).

This PR also moves direction and alignment types to tidy up the top-level API.

Edit: also added `Cast` and `CastFloat` traits.

title: Conv and ConvFloat conversion traits, i32 in Size, new Offset type, fn extract
body:
Replaces most uses of `as` for type-casting with new conversion traits, with accuracy checks at least during debug mode. (Possibly these traits should be spun off into a new crate.)

The `Size` type now uses `i32` instead of `u32` to avoid converting everywhere.

`Size` was made a vector type, then vector uses were replaced with a new `Offset` type so that `Size` can check values are non-negative *at least sometimes*.

Also fixes some missing redraws.

title: Work2
body:
Reduce the number of resize actions.

Fix rounding with `f32 → u32` conversion on text size requirements.

Fix a bug where *not* reducing the allocated widget number in ViewList caused an issue when frame-swapping? (At any rate, we no longer crash on frame-swap errors and I no longer see any frame-swap errors.)

ViewList is now a nav fallback candidate. Calling `set_accel_string` now triggers a reconfigure if the keys change.

All grab handles now use the "grab" cursor icon (I don't see this icon widely used in other apps, but it certainly helps with positioning when using the splitter and scrollbars).

title: make TkAction a bitflags struct; pass mgr to set_rect
body:
`TkAction` is now a bitflags struct instead of an enum, allowing actions to be triggered independently (instead of progressively).

`Layout::set_rect` now takes `&mut Manager` instead of `&dyn SizeHandle` parameter (we could have simply added a `TkAction` return value, but this seemed the better choice, especially considering the size handle is rarely used here and it adds options like scheduling updates from `set_rect`).

`ViewList::set_rect` can now trigger a reconfigure when required. Currently resizes happen too frequently, but that's for another PR.
